title: Create and edit aggregation providers
content:
Aggregation providers represent end-point systems that are integrated with the suite to provide services such as cloud services. After an aggregation provider is created, the catalog manager who has the proper privilege can create aggregated offerings based on the services from this provider.

Notes:

  • To see the AGGREGATION PROVIDER menu item from Administration > Utilities > Providers, make sure that:
    • The tenant admin turns on Enable aggregation in  Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
    • At least one of the experience modes available in the current release is selected in Administration > Configuration > Application Settings.
    • The users' role has the Ability to view all administration modules privilege.
    • The users' role has the Create/View/Update/Delete privilege to the Provider record.
  • Before you add an aggregation provider, make sure that you create the tenant key chain in  Administration > Configuration > Application Settings > Tenant key chain. Otherwise, you can't save the provider record because the Password field for the integration user is an encrypted field that requires the tenant key chain for encryption.

Create an aggregation provider

Note: This section is to add a DND provider that's deployed and enabled in the same suite system. 

To add an aggregation provider that's deployed and enabled in the current suite system, follow these steps:

  1. From the main menu of Service Management, select Administration > Utilities > Providers.
  2. In the AGGREGATION PROVIDER view, click the New button.
  3. In the New Provider page, fill in and select Basic provider properties:
    1. In the Title field, type a descriptive name for the new provider
    2. Select the System type such as Service Design and Deployment. After the System Type is selected, additional General and Integration user sections are displayed.
  4. In the General section, type the URL to the provider system. In the URL field enter https://itom-dnd-controller-svc:8444/dnd
  5. In the Integration user section, type the Login name and Password of the integration user who can access the provider system.
    Note: To add a DND provider, you must use the DND Integration user that the suite admin has created and configured when deploying the DND capability. You can get the username and password of the DND Integration user from your suite admin.
  6. (Optional) In the Fulfillment plan section, select a fulfillment plan, which will be used as the fulfillment plan for the offerings aggregated from this provider.
    Only the plans in the Cloud Service Request type can be selected. If no fulfillment plan is selected, the default fulfillment task plan will be added to aggregated offerings.
  7. Click SAVE. The aggregation provider is created.

Edit an aggregation provider

  1. From the main menu of Service Management, select Administration > Utilities > Providers.
  2. In the AGGREGATION PROVIDER view, click the provider in the ID column to display the selected provider.
  3. In the provider detail page, type new values for the provider's properties that you want modify.
  4. Click Save to save your changes.

Important: Do not delete the aggregation provider when you have offerings (active or inactive) aggregated from this provider.
